8. Greg Evans

# Greg Evans

![Greg Evans](https://www.eugene-or.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentID=21873)

## Eugene City Councilor, Ward 6

**Term: January 2023– January 2027**

500 East 4th Avenue, Suite 302, Eugene, OR 97401

Phone: 541-682-8346;

Fax: 541-682-5414

[**Email Councilor Evans**](mailto:gevans@eugene-or.gov)

Email sent to an elected official becomes a public record that may be subject to inspection and copying by the public. For further information please refer to the [website privacy policy](https://www.eugene-or.gov/1353). When submitting comments, please include your [ward number](https://www.eugene-or.gov/532) or address in your communication to the City Council. Providing this information will identify concerns and questions for the [City Councilor representing your ward](https://www.eugene-or.gov/537).

### Community Service / Involvement

- Lane Transit District, Board of Directors
- Lane County Fair Board, President
- City of Eugene Planning Commission
- City of Eugene Sister Cities Committee
- National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, Eugene/Springfield
- NAACP Washington/Oregon Conference
- National League of Cities Board of Directors
- NLC Board Finance Committee
- NLC Transportation and Infrastructure Services Committee (2016-2017)
- NLC Universities and Colleges Communities Committee (2013-2017)
- League of Oregon Cities, 2019 President
- Youth Coach, Kidsports, Eugene YMCA, Emerald Valley Little League

### Current Council Assignments

- Budget Committee
- Intergovernmental Relations Committee
- Lane Transit District Strategic Planning Committee

### Professional Background

- Associate Vice-President for Equity and Inclusion, Chief Diversity Officer, Lane Community College
- Coordinator/Instructor African American Student Programs, Lane Community
  
  College

### Educational Background

- ME.d, College Student Services Administration, Oregon State University
- B.S., Marketing, Dyke College, Cleveland, Ohio

### Special Interests and Concerns

- Transportation policy
- Civil and human rights
- Education
